pmhal_lp8731_lp3907.c File Reference

Power Management IC - LP8731/LP3907 and LP3907 specific API implementation. APIs are exported by using function pointers. More...

#include <stdint.h>
#include <stddef.h>
#include <ti/csl/hw_types.h>

#include "pmhal_pmic.h"
#include <ti/drv/pm/include/pmic/pmhal_lp8731_lp3907.h>
#include "pmhal_pmicComm.h"
#include "pmhal_prcm.h"

void PMHALLP8731LP3907ConfigureRegulatorMap (pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMapPtr_t regulatorMap)
 The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2| | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator | | | refer |

| | #pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };. More...
 

Variables

const pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorProp_t gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator [PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_MAX]
 

Detailed Description

Power Management IC - LP8731/LP3907 and LP3907 specific API implementation. APIs are exported by using function pointers.

Function Documentation

static uint32_t PmhalLP8731LP3907CheckRegulatorEnabled ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

Is the given regulator enabled? This utility function must only be called by functions in this file and the caller must ensure that the PMIC communication is configured and enabled before calling this function.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
Returns
TRUE if regulator is enabled; FALSE otherwise.
void PMHALLP8731LP3907ConfigureRegulatorMap ( pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMapPtr_t  regulatorMap)

The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2| | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator | | | refer |

| | #pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };.

Parameters
regulatorMapPointer to the array of pointers which gives the mapping. The array is defined as above.
Returns
None
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8731LP3907DisableRegulator ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

Disable the given regulator. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters

Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS/FAIL otherwise.

Get PMIC ops structure. All the other functions are accessed via function pointers whose array is exported by this function.

static

Parameters
productIdThe Product ID is populated in this parameter.
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static uint32_t PMHALLP8731LP3907GetRegulatorConvVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  avsVoltage 
)
static

Return the Regulator Step voltage size. This is required by the voltage manager to understand the opp for the given voltage set for the given voltage rail.

Parameters
regIdRegulator ID. Refer pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t for details.
avsVoltageAVS voltage which is to be converted to regulator voltage
Returns
convVolt The voltage that would be supplied by the regulator if the AVS voltage is given to the API. NOTE: This API does not program the PMIC. It just returns the calculated value of AVS voltage converted to PMIC voltage based on the PMIC voltage resolution.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8731LP3907GetRegulatorVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t *  voltage 
)
static

Get the voltage setting of the given regulator. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
voltageVoltage in mV returned.
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.

Returns

static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8731LP3907IsPresent ( void  )
static

Check if the LP8731/LP3907 PMIC is present. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
void
Returns
PM_SUCCESS - LP8731/LP3907 PMIC is present. PM_PMHAL_PMIC_VENDOR_ID_INVALID - PMIC vendor id doesn't match the expected value. PM_PMHAL_PMIC_PRODUCT_ID_INVALID - PMIC product id doesn't match the expected value.
static uint32_t PMHALLP8731LP3907IsRegulatorEnabled ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

API to check if the given regulator enabled. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
Returns
enabled TRUE if regulator is enabled; FALSE otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8731LP3907ReadPhyAddr ( uint8_t  i2cNum,
uint8_t  slaveAddress,
uint32_t  phyAddr,
uint32_t *  value 
)
static

Read the register value at the given physical address.

Parameters
i2cNumThe I2C line number to which the PMIC is connected.
slaveAddressThe I2C number used on the board to connect to the desired PMIC.
phyAddrAddress to be read.
valueReturns the value read.
Returns
status Return PM_SUCCESS if read is successful. Else returns PM_FAIL.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8731LP3907SetRegulatorVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  voltage,
uint32_t  timeout 
)
static

Set the voltage of the regulator to the mV given. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

NOTE: PMIC allows controlling the voltage in many ways. The approach taken by this routine is to use the current configuration for voltage setting and try to succeed. It doesn't try to alter the configuration to ensure success.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
voltageVoltage in mV returned.
timeoutTimeout iterations to wait for setting the right regulator voltage value. Possible values can be: PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT Do not wait for voltage setting. PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE Wait infinitely till the voltage is set. Non Zero Value Wait for the time provided by the user.
Returns
Status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8731LP3907VoltageToVselOffset ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  voltage,
uint32_t *  vsel 
)
static

Given voltage in mV and range, return the VSEL offset.

vselVSEL value returned.

status
static uint32_t PmhalLP8731LP3907VselOffsetToVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  vsel 
)

Given VSEL offset convert it to voltage in mV and return.

static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8731LP3907WritePhyAddr ( uint8_t  i2cNum,
uint8_t  slaveAddress,
uint32_t  phyAddr,
uint32_t  value 
)
static

Write the given register value at the given physical address.

Parameters
i2cNumThe I2C line number to which the PMIC is connected.
slaveAddressThe I2C number used on the board to connect to the desired PMIC.
phyAddrAddress to be written to.
valueReturns the value to be written.
Returns
Return success or failure.

Data structure to describe the properties for all the regulators.
